tweets.text: Great news! Our geomorphologists have worked closely with colleagues in @EnvAgencySW to help develop this scheme, which places restoration of natural geomorphic functioning at the heart of #ClimateAdaptation https://t.co/uIWXCVwcBP
@amberiow @Ameyplc @iwight @EnvAgency Hi Amber, please allow us to look into this. Could you send us a DM? Thanks, Kyle

Huge congratulations to @EnvAgencyMids for taking action to support staff & help reduce unnecessary car trips through their #TravelPlan. @ModeshiftSTARS Business Bronze Accreditation is yours! #brumbreathes 👏🏅🚶‍♀️🚲 https://t.co/Vj8zTEMQUR

A ground breaking project to help the Lower Otter Valley in East Devon adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve has been approved by East Devon Council. Planners gave the project a unanimous thumbs-up earlier today https://t.co/1kIdi1CZcy https://t.co/y0bJb1aWsB

urls.title: Planners give green light to Otter Valley project
urls.description: A project to help a river valley adapt to climate change and create an internationally important wildlife reserve now has planning permission.

tweets.text: So @Ameyplc - our recycling hadn’t been collected now since before Christmas. We apparently can’t call you and the @iwight are totally useless. Any ideas before we create a serious health hazard and @EnvAgency have to become involved?? Your prompt response would be appreciated!!

tweets.text: This is a huge result for #ClimateAdaptation. The River Otter has been trying to reconnect with its flood plain since 1812. This is partnered with a similar project in the Saâne Valley in France. If successful the model will be rolled out further. #RacetoResilience #adaptourworld https://t.co/LWKN3wdVG6
The managed realignment, proposed by landowner Clinton Devon Estates and the @EnvAgency, is designed to avoid a catastrophic breach of embankments which were built over 200 years ago. [3/4]
Haven’t @EnvAgency had significantly increased funding specifically to fund waste crime initiatives over recent years? EA warned Eustice on waste crime funding https://t.co/WMqoh87vyb

tweets.text: Pollution still pouring down the river Yare today at UEA. That’s 15 days  from first being reported now... the whole river reeks of diesel. Reported again to the EA. https://t.co/ZzcT2TK4RJ

@Nick_Everard @metoffice @EnvAgencyNW An interesting subject. We have 2 manual gauges around 650m on Helvellyn, significantly higher than Honister at 358m, yet their LTAs are considerably less. Must depend greatly on exposure, orientation etc. I'm sure it would make a great study project. Any innovative ideas?

The destruction of England's waterways - by over extracting water and routinely dumping raw sewage - and the @EnvAgency's complicity in it is one of the great untold scandals.

We at @GoodLawProject are putting together a formidable team to take this on.
https://t.co/Q4gCrffC2j

urls.description: The Environment Agency is failing to meet the terms of a court order which demanded that it act to protect dozens of protected waterways from agricultural sewage, placing some of the country’s most

tweets.text: Rising complaints of foul odours from the direction of Walley’s Quarry landfill in Silverdale. 😷The Environment Agency @EnvAgencyMids need to use their powers to investigate and act. I will be speaking to our MP @AaronBell4NUL about this again tomorrow. We will up the pressure. https://t.co/AlneDdVTcm

@JolyonMaugham @EnvAgency @GoodLawProject Just wait until #HS2 drill through the Chilterns aquifer and pollute London's drinking water, let alone what the tunnel through the Misbourne valley will do to its eponomous river and the interconnected river Chess

PC Moss

@ENVAgencyNW

@iainrbarreco hi, if this is still happening then please keep on reporting this to our Incident team. The more reports the better. Its a free contact number to call on, available 24/7- 0800 80 70 60.
